""' ' ' '"*"It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET 97 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held in the Prime ministers room, House of Commons, S.W. 1, on Tuesday, July 28, 1942, at 12-15 p.m.Present :The Right Hon. Winston S. Churchill, M.P., Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P.,Secretary of State for DominionAffairs.The Right Hon. Sir John Anderson,M.P., Lord President of the Council.The Right Hon. Oliver Lyttelton,M.P., Minister of Production.The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal. -The Right Hon. Anthony Eden, M.P.,Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.The Right Hon. Ernest Bevin, M.P.,Minister of Labour and NationalService.Sir Edward Bridges, Secretary.oContents.minute no. Subject. page 1 Parliament ............................ 1622 The Press ........... .... ............ 1623 The General War Situation ........ ............ 162[24162] 1. The War Cabinet were informed that, in the House ofLords that afternoon, Lord Brabazon proposed : "To call attentionto the present distribution and use of aircraft." This wouldcertainly lead to discussion on our bombing policy.The War Cabinet-Decided that a Debate on this matter could only take placein private, and asked that this view should be conveyed tothe Secretary of State for the Colonies.2. Attention was drawn to an article in the Daily Mirror that morning about a report from Washington that General Marshallwas to be appointed Generalissimo of the Allied Forces. Thearticle was critical of the suggestion that an American general should be put in supreme charge of a force comprising american and British troops.The War Cabinet-Instructed the Secretary to suggest to the Minister ofInformation that he should see the Editors, explain theposition to them in confidence, and ask them to discouragespeculation on this matter at present.The General 3. The War Cabinet had a general discussion on the war war Situation, situation and the development of our war effort.In the course of the discussion the War Cabinet Asked the Chiefs of Staff to arrange for a generalappreciation to be prepared of the military situation in west Africa at the present time, including the security ofthe Takoradi-Khartum air route.Great George Street, S.W. 1,July 28, 1942.Parliament.The Press.
